name: Roy Tang
text: So you randomly select a "drug user":  The pool of possible drug users is: 1.3M correctly identified as drug users + 1% (false positives) of the remaining (102.3M - 1.3M = 101M) non drug users = around 1.01M  So odds of wrongly killing a false positive are 1.01 / (1.31 + 1.01) = around 43%. Yep, math checks out haha
